item.description:
This event open to Sea Kayaks and Recreational Kayaks 10ft or greater

Nature has reclaimed this 19th century Durham farm. Lesser known and not easy to locate, Adams Point offers a mile-long view of the tidal Great Bay estuary. A great place for bird watching, photography and launching small boats.

Information about Jackson Labs Marine Research Center

Click on Photo above for view of Launch Site at Adam's Point

Directions:

*Take Route 108 to Bay Road in Newmarket.
* Turn onto Bay and follow it for about four miles. Watch for the entrance of Adams Point, a state
park, just after the small bridge over Crommet Creek.
There is a signfor Jackson Labs Facility - part of UNH - at that entrance.

Or, on Route 108 in Durham, turn onto Durham Point Road.
* Go about three miles. Watch for the entrance of Adams Point on the left a few hundred yards after passing Dame Road on the right.

There is a sign for Jackson Labs Facility - part of UNH - at that entrance.

There is additional parking at the top of the hill

Life Vests aka PFDs must be worn when paddling with this group

Google Maps directions to Adam's Point Boat Launch Durham NH
item.name: Great Bay from Adams's Point Paddle
